decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast-paced and aggressive gameplay, utilizing efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes powerful support cards like Lightning Bolt and Blood Moon to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency to the deck, ensuring that the player always has access to additional resources. Overall, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach and Urza's Saga to combo off and win the game quickly. By using Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to dig for important pieces, along with Mishra's Bauble and Mox Amber to generate mana, the deck aims to assemble the combo pieces of Grinding Station and Thassa's Oracle to win the game in a single turn. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Malevolent Rumble and Unholy Heat to control the game and protect the combo.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Explore and Amulet of Vigor in order to cast Primeval Titan and search for powerful lands such as Vesuva and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. By generating a significant amount of mana, the deck aims to combo off and win the game by activating Valakut's effect multiple times or generating a lethal attack with Primeval Titan and other creatures like Dryad of the Ilysian Grove. The deck also includes utility lands like Bojuka Bog and The One Ring to provide additional support and control options.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Amulet of Vigor and Arboreal Grazer to cast Primeval Titan and search for powerful lands like Urza's Saga or Boseiju, Who Endures. By assembling the right combination of lands, the deck can generate infinite mana and win the game with a combo finish. Additionally, cards like Urza's Cave and Commercial District provide additional utility and versatility to the deck's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm opponents with a powerful end game.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and using powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The key strategy is to maintain board presence with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu while controlling the opponent's plays with Stubborn Denial and Leyline Binding. The companion Jegantha, the Wellspring provides additional mana support, allowing for explosive plays. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of speed and versatility, utilizing a diverse range of spells and creatures to secure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures like Ragavan and Amped Raptor, while utilizing cards like Guide of Souls and Ajani to maintain board presence and efficiency. The deck also includes disruption elements like Static Prison and Lightning Bolt to control the battlefield. The inclusion of cards like The One Ring and Phlage provide additional power and versatility to the deck. Additionally, the deck utilizes lands like Marsh Flats and Arid Mesa to quickly fetch the necessary colors of mana for its spells and creatures.

This deck focuses on utilizing Leyline Binding and Indomitable Creativity to cheat out powerful creatures and win conditions quickly. By ramping up mana with lands like Dwarven Mine and utilizing Wrenn and Six for additional land plays, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with high-impact creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Valgavoth, Terror Eater. With a mix of removal spells and protection from cards like Spell Pierce and Reprieve, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while setting up its own game-winning combos.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using Eldrazi Temple and various mana rocks, allowing you to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Defiler. The deck also features cards like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Command to control the board and disrupt your opponent's plans. Through the Breach serves as a way to cheat huge Eldrazi into play, while cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Ugin's Labyrinth provide additional support and protection for your creatures. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with massive threats and powerful spells.

The deck revolves around using Amulet of Vigor to generate extra mana and play Primeval Titan quickly to search for powerful lands such as The One Ring and Urza's Saga. This allows the deck to ramp up quickly and create a powerful board state. The inclusion of cards like Scapeshift and Lotus Field support this strategy, providing additional ways to generate mana and search for key pieces. The deck aims to establish a strong mana base and overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and powerful land abilities.

This deck focuses on utilizing Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to quickly ramp up mana, allowing for explosive plays such as searching for multiple lands with The One Ring or setting up lethal Scapeshift combos. The inclusion of cards like Arboreal Grazer and Azusa, Lost but Seeking helps to accelerate land drops, while Expedition Map and Tolaria West provide additional land tutor options. With the right setup, this deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with powerful Titan searches and land combos to secure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burning spells. The deck aims to apply early pressure with creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Amped Raptor, while also utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge for direct damage. The inclusion of Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, Goblin Bombardment, and Static Prison also helps to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of efficient creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on fast, aggressive play, utilizing creatures like Amped Raptor and Ocelot Pride to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge to finish off weakened opponents. The inclusion of static prison and blood moon disrupts the opponent's game plan, while the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring provides additional resources. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain board control to secure a swift victory.

The main focus of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Amped Raptor, while utilizing powerful cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to maintain board presence and deal damage efficiently. The deck also aims to control the opponent's board with cards like Galvanic Discharge and Static Prison, while utilizing cards like The One Ring and Ocelot Pride to buff its creatures and push through for lethal damage. Additionally, cards like Blood Moon and Goblin Bombardment provide disruption and alternate win conditions.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures to combo off using Yawgmoth, Thran Physician's ability to sacrifice creatures for value. By utilizing various creatures with abilities such as undying, persist, and death triggers, the deck aims to generate incremental advantage and drain opponents with Zulaport Cutthroat. The deck also includes mana accelerants like Ignoble Hierarch and Wall of Roots to help ramp into its combo pieces quickly. Additionally, cards like Chord of Calling provide versatile tutoring options for finding specific creatures in the toolbox.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Fatal Push and Abhorrent Oculus, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Cling to Dust and Sink into Stupor. Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog provide threats that can close out the game, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student offers card advantage. The deck relies on efficient spell interaction and resource management to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory.

The main strategy of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage. By using a combination of counterspells, removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, and bounce effects like Psychic Frog and Stern Scolding, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. Additionally, Murktide Regent provides a threat that can close out the game quickly if left unchecked. The deck also includes card selection and card draw spells like Preordain and Consider to ensure consistency in finding the right answers.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor along with lands that provide additional mana generation and utility to quickly ramp up and play Primeval Titans. The key strategy is to efficiently tutor for specific lands using cards like Expedition Map and Tolaria West in order to assemble the necessary combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Titan creatures. Utilizing cards like The One Ring and Aftermath Analyst further enhances the strength of the Titans, allowing for explosive plays and overwhelming board presence.

Utilize land ramp and mana generation with Amulet of Vigor to quickly search for and play Primeval Titan, triggering The One Ring for additional value. Use cards like Explore and Arboreal Grazer to accelerate land drops and search for key pieces like Urza's Saga. Utilize the powerful lands in the deck to create a strong mana base and potentially search for combo pieces like Scapeshift. Employ Aftermath Analyst to draw additional cards and maintain card advantage. Win through overwhelming board presence and value generation from Primeval Titan and The One Ring.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. The deck includes powerful red and white creatures, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt, to deal damage to the opponent's creatures or directly to their life total. The addition of cards like Static Prison and Blood Moon can disrupt the opponent's strategy and give the deck the upper hand in the match. Overall, this deck aims to be fast-paced and relentless in its assault on the opponent.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The main strategy is to play efficient creatures like Amped Raptor and Ocelot Pride, backed up by burn spells such as Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge to finish off the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Static Prison and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury helps control the board and protect your creatures. Jegantha, the Wellspring provides additional mana acceleration and flexibility, while The One Ring can be a powerful finisher. This deck aims to win the game quickly through aggressive creature and burn spell damage.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures and burn spells while using Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion for additional mana ramp. The deck includes powerful cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with aggressive creatures like Amped Raptor and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer. The deck also utilizes disruption elements with cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison to control the board and secure victory. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure and close out the game quickly.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Death's Shadow and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure on the opponent. It also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Lightning Bolt to control the board. The deck's key strategy is to lower its own life total to increase the power of Death's Shadow and activate other cards like Detective's Phoenix. The goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent and win through creature damage while using removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. It aims to slow down the opponent's strategy while efficiently drawing cards and protecting its own threats. The deck utilizes a mix of versatile counterspells, targeted removal, and graveyard recursion to maintain control of the game. By utilizing powerful control tools and disruptive elements, it aims to outlast the opponent and take over the game with its own win conditions.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disruption and removal, utilizing cards like Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Force of Negation to control the board while deploying threats like Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters. It also includes card advantage engines like Subtlety and Psychic Frog, allowing the player to outvalue their opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while slowly grinding them out through creature removal and counter spells. It also includes a variety of land cards to ensure smooth mana base for consistent plays.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through various means such as counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while slowly building up its own board presence. It utilizes a combination of creatures with disruptive abilities, efficient removal spells, and card filtering to maintain control over the game. The inclusion of cards like Murktide Regent and Harbinger of the Seas provides additional threats that can quickly close out the game once the opponent has been sufficiently disrupted.

The deck focuses on using ramp cards like Talisman of Impulse and Eldrazi Temple to quickly play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Defiler. The deck also features control elements like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Through the Breach allows for early creature deployment, while Ancient Stirrings helps to find key pieces of the deck. The combination of control elements and Eldrazi creatures creates a powerful and adaptable strategy for the deck.

This Naya Zoo deck focuses on aggressive creature-based strategies, aiming to flood the board with efficient threats and overwhelm the opponent quickly. The deck utilizes cards like Renegade Rallier and Guide of Souls to provide extra value and maintain board presence. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury can deal massive damage if left unchecked, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah can create tokens and pump up the team. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells and mana ramp, along with lands that enable easy casting of the various colored spells in the deck.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and using efficient removal spells to control the board. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion adds a unique deckbuilding restriction, but the deck is still able to consistently apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of powerful creatures like Phlage and Guide of Souls, along with versatile removal spells such as Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and close out the game swiftly. The inclusion of Goblin Bombardment adds an additional source of damage and reach to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly milling the opponent's library using cards like Hedron Crab, Ruin Crab, and Archive Trap while controlling the board with cards like Fatal Push and Drown in the Loch. Visions of Beyond and Glimpse the Unthinkable provide card advantage, while Surgical Extraction disrupts the opponent's graveyard strategy. Fractured Sanity can potentially mill a large portion of the opponent's library at once, leading to a swift victory. The deck also includes removal spells like Murderous Cut and Toxic Deluge for dealing with opposing threats. Field of Ruin and other utility lands help fix mana and disrupt the opponent's land base.
